list_definition.definition: to crawl or climb quickly, using arms and legs
(with for) to rush, or struggle with others, to get

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: The boys scrambled for the ball.

list_definition.definition: to distort (a telephone message etc) so that it can only be received and understood with a special receiver.
(sometimes with for) an act of scrambling; a rush or struggle

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: There was a scramble for the best bargains.

list_ex_of_english: Again, agencies scrambled to make placements, because now they earned money by doing so.
